frameDefinitions: A Member is semi-permanently part of a socially constructed Group.
An Evaluator participates in an Experience (or metonymically, a salient Entity of the Experience), often for the first time, in order to form an opinion about its quality.
A Tester uses a concrete or conceptual Product in order to determine either whether it works or to find out how well or in which manner it works.
An Experimenter conducts an Experiment based on a Hypothesis.
An Agent attempts to achieve a Goal.
An Agent attempts to achieve a Goal using some Means.
frameExamples: Victor is <t>part</t> of the Red Crescent
Have you <t>tried</t> my latest get-rich-quick scheme? INI
Sun has (hopefully) already <t>tested</t> it for compliance.
Johann's <t><fex name='Experiment'>experiment</fex></t> proved the new drug was effective in treating the disease.
John <t>tried</t> using a crowbar to open the door.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who belongs to a <fen>Group</fen>.
A set of people standing in a semi-permanent relationship together.
The time at which the <fen>Member</fen> is a member of the <fen>Group</fen>.
The location where the membership relationship holds.
The person (or metonymic manifestation thereof) that participates in the <fen>Experience</fen>.
The activity or event that the <fen>Evaluator</fen> participates in.
<fen>Entity</fen> is something that the <fen>Evaluator</fen> uses to try an <fen>Experience</fen>, and metonymically stands in for the <fen>Experience</fen>.
A more explicit description of what the <fen>Evaluator</fen> seeks to learn by having the <fen>Experience</fen>.
The temporal location during which the <fen>Experience</fen> occurs.
The physical location in which the <fen>Experience</fen> occurs.
The person who uses  the <fen>Product</fen> to see if it is intact or to ascertain its characteristics during operation.
The entity that the <fen>Tester</fen> uses  to ascertain whether it is intact.
An entity or property whose presence would impair the acceptability or usefulness of the <fen>Product</fen>.
An action that the <fen>Tester</fen> intends to accomplish subjecting the <fen>Product</fen> to a test of its functioning.
The desirable state of affairs which the <fen>Tester</fen> hopes to find to obtain when using the <fen>Product</fen>.
A variable of behavior of the <fen>Product</fen> which is specifically evaluated.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Tester</fen> uses  the <fen>Product</fen> to evaluate its functioning.
The location in which the test is carried out.
The <fen>Experimenter</fen> is the individual conducting the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The group of entities in the <fen>Experiment</fen> which have not been treated and are compared to the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
An individual entity of the <fen>Experiment</fen> which is left untreated and then compared with the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or the <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
A group of subjects that receive Treatment and are compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fex name='Controlled_individual'>Controlled_individuals</fex>.
An individual subject that receives treatment and is then compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fen>Controlled_individual</fen>.
The test or <fen>Experiment</fen> conducted by the <fen>Experimenter</fen> using a <fen>Control_group</fen> and a <fen>Treatment_group</fen>.
The <fen>Hypothesis</fen> is a conjecture as to the result of an <fen>Experiment</fen>.  The <fen>Experiment</fen> takes place in order to prove the <fen>Hypothesis</fen> as correct or incorrect.

In this frame <fen>Control_group</fen> and <fen>Treatment_group</fen> can be combined and expressed as <fen>Subjects</fen>.  This role can also be used for a generic individual on whom the <fen>Experiment</fen> is being conducted (see second example).
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject that the <fen>Experiment</fen> is studying.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Experimenter</fen> conducts the <fen>Experiment</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> in which the <fen>Experiment</fen> is conducted.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.
The place where an attempt is made.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
This role identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an attempt occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.
The place where an attempt is made.
listRoleExamples: Two <fex>members</fex> of the Red Cross were here about a donation
<fex>She</fex> tested out six cars before finding the one she liked.
Have you ever tried <fex>working out with kettlebells?</fex>
We tried out <fex>the games</fex>, and they're fun.
I tried out my neighbors vacuums <fex>to see if they met my needs</fex>
Try it out <fex>at midnight</fex>.
I tried it for the first time <fex>at home</fex>.
I just wish <fex>we</fex> could have tested the car with a manual gearbox, instead of the five-speed automatic
To ensure that the remedy is complete, nCipher have fully reviewed the software and tested it <fex>for similar errors</fex>.
Once you have copied your site and have tested it <fex>to make sure it works normally</fex>, you're ready to pull out the scalpel and start hacking away.
Test-Driven Development requires you to set an expectation of a result and then test <fex>that the result is achieved</fex>.
ILCSO staff have tested <fex>the behavior of the ILCSO-standard version of WebVoyage with several browsers</fex>.
We tested the product <fex>in California</fex> first.
<fex>Justin's</fex> experiment turned out to be rather successful.
<fex>One rat's</fex> treatment caused it to outlive the rats of the control group.
Katrina tested <fex>her hypothesis</fex> yesterday afternoon.
They were hoping to conduct an experiment <fex>on the albino rats</fex>.
Jimmy conducted an experiment <fex>on tropical plants in non-tropical environments</fex>.
<fex>John</fex> attempted to climb Mt. Everest.
John attempted <fex>to climb Mt. Everest</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he attempted to put the wig on.
<fex>Dana</fex> tried a crowbar.
John tried using a crowbar <fex>to enter the locked door</fex>.
Dana tried <fex>using a crowbar</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he tried the crowbar.
